H0.text: Changes in nuclei are what the term “decay” in chemistry refers to with regards to atoms.

H1.text: Pressures in nuclei refer to the term decay in chemistry with regards to atoms.

H2.text: Destruction of nuclei is what the term decay refers to in chemistry with regards to atoms.

H3.text: Separation of nuclei is what the term decay in chemistry refers to with regards to atoms.

A4.text: Radioactive decay involves nuclear transmutation, resulting in a daughter nuclide with a different number of protons or neutrons (or both).

A5.text: Beta decay transforms a neutron into a proton or vice versa, altering the atomic number of the nucleus.
